description: Can't move it in Ubuntu 21.10

I loved this app on Mint, but had a few problems on fresh install of Kubuntu. The sticky notes don't show content. When I right click on the sticky window to close it, it would freeze for over 10 seconds, then eventually it would either show the content or shutdown. Opening a new note window also lagged.
It doesn't save the notes

It really works for me (Ubuntu 19.04, Gnome 3.34.1). Though the app has some bugs (it even crashed the system when I played around with layout settings for a concrete note), I would like to thank the author.
No save functionality, can't resize or even move notes. Only possibly useful for temporary notes, but why not just save it in a text file or the name of a folder?

description: Does what it says.
Can't move it, Not what we expected.
I can't move the notes , they stay fixed in the screen ...

I created a note then exited the app and restarted it; 
the note I created didn't come back. I then looked for some feature or option to explicitly save or set implicit saving of notes (like in preferences) - there was no such feature to be found. I specifically wanted a note program that would keep a persistent database of the notes I create - this app is not that. Otherwise it would have been an okay app (and yes, if you enable window decorations you then get a window title bar that allows for moving note windows around on the desktop)
Very useful indeed with nice look. Seems sticky notes in Linux.
Installed, nothing appeared
Close the app the notes are gone. Not what i wanted.

Just installed it, love it. The issues in the other reviews do not *appear* be a problem on my Kubuntu 20.04 install. I have closed the app, restarted and my notes show up when I click the tray icon, no probs.

I hope the multiple bug reports are edge cases because this is the first note app I've found that actually does exactly what I want without a bunch of added functionality like builtin claculators and whatnot that is handled better by other apps for me.

If this review is not updated over the next few days then, Dear Reader, it means the app is the outstanding choice I am hoping for and which so far appears to be.
summary: Is there a bug bomb waiting?

description:
Thank you for keeping it simple. I installed this on a laptop with a 15 inch screen and the last thing I need are GIANT sticky notes with ugly tool bars all over the desktop.

Xpad is exactly what I was looking for. The preference controls allowed me to set the defaults the way I want them so all future notes open the same way while giving me the option to customize an individual note. I have no need for the toolbars and was able to do away with those as well leaving clean, simple notes on my desktop. I have it set up to start automatically so my notes are there in plain view when I start my laptop.

Another appreciated feature was the option to not display the Xpad icon in the taskbar. This did present a problem when I deleted all notes and needed to open a new one. There seemed to be no way to do this since there is no icon on the taskbar. The solution was simple… place the cursor on the desktop where you want the new note, open the terminal window and type “xpad -n”. A new note will open and any further notes can be opened by using “Ctrl-n”.

Xpad also has a very detailed help file making it so simple to customize. I do not understand the negative reviews.
summary: Simple with a ton of options!

description: Nice widget stickly pad. Configure-able.
summary: Great App. Xpad is what I want. Thanks!

description: The only thing, I don't like of this sticky note is the impossibility of move a sticky note per drag and drop in the desktop. So it is unsable for me. I'm very sad about it, because I want a app with notes on Desktop.

If you need to jot down quick thoughts as they pop into your head, paste links and text, make a note of an email address mid-phonecall when you realise you haven't got a pen etc. and want it all to still be there after a reboot, this will do the job.

To move, minimise etc you need to right-click on a note, go to Preferences, View and check the 'Show window decorations' box. That will add the usual top-bar with the Minimise/Maximise/Close buttons on the top and can be dragged.

Alternatively, you can drag a note by holding Ctrl while left-clicking.
summary: Not perfect but it does the job

description: On start up it create's a new note, you need to right click, go in to the Preferences settings, then select the Startup tab and uncheck the "open a new empty pad" option. Close and this should correct this new emplty pad on startup for you. Hope this helps. Good little program so far.
